data.title: Arranged Marriage In The Movie Sweet Land - 886 Words
data.meta_description: Free Essay: The move “sweet Land,” directed by Ali Selim, depicts two immigrants and their struggle to live happily in the United States, and the mark they...
data.text: The move “sweet Land,” directed by Ali Selim, depicts two immigrants and their struggle to live happily in the United States, and the mark they leave on younger generations. The main characters of the film are Inge and Olaf Torvik, a couple that has only come together from the arranged marriage of Olaf’s parents. Throughout the film, Inge and Olaf experience a conflict with the community and America because their marriage is unable to be validated, the bank is attempting to foreclose on Olaf’s and Francen’s farms, and the community treats them as an outcast because of Inga’s German heritage. Even though the film may make it look otherwise, Olaf Torvik is the Protagonist even though the main character in the film is Inge. Olaf has struggled throughout the film with marrying Inge due to the distrust of the community after the end of World War 1, preventing them from obtaining citizenship for Inge and a validated marriage license. Also, Olaf chooses to place his own farm on the line in order to help his friend Francen from the repossession of Banker Harmo, something that nobody else in the community would do. Olaf is attempting to strive for his version of the American dream, in which he and his friends have successful farms and families, he is married to Inge, and they are accepted and apart of the local community. The film supports these ideas and allows us to identify with Olaf because it is what many of us strive for in our life, having a happy and healthy family, a
